result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Celio Lugo

records.addlTxt: Justice Point modified to LEVEL 3. All other conditions remain.

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Cecilio Barrios Lugo Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has received a global offer and parties are continuing negotiations. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 36. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.
received and filed

Defendant Celio Lugo in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Celio Lugo.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders 22CM1352 be transferred to Branch 13. Defendant was found competent in felony matter, 21CF3722, court adopts findings. Defendant is competent to proceed. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS Report received and filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision ( VIOLATION) Report, received and filed

Defendant Celio Lugo in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 37.  Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Seipel's report.  Defense does challenge the report.  Parties stipulate to Dr. Seipel's qualifications.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Matthew Seipel.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.

After review of all evidence, report of and testimony of Dr. Seipel, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court took no action as to medication order as defendant is compliant with treatment.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency in the Outpatient Restoration Program.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed. 

Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 38.   **All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Branch 13, RESERVE JUDGES, in Room 508 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.

Defendant Celio Lugo in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant has a competency hearing in Branch 38.  This case will be heard in Branch 38 for competency hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Celio Lugo in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Celio Lugo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant has a pending case in Branch 38, 21CF3722, where defense has raised competency.   Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit on 21CF3722.   Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctors report in Branch 37.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Celio Lugo in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Celio Lugo in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
